perturbation.original_text: 1.74 “Minimum Requirements” means the investments and activities identified as “Minimum Requirements” in a Commercialization Plan.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.74 “Minimum Requirements” means the investments and activities identified as requirements in a Commercialization Plan.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the word “Minimum”, it implies that all investments and activities in the Commercialization plan are mandatory. This contrasts with other clauses that allow for flexibility and commercially reasonable efforts, potentially creating disputes over enforcement and compliance.

perturbation.original_text:
1.26 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts” means: (a) with respect to the efforts to be expended, or considerations to be undertaken, by a Party or its
Affiliate with respect to any objective, activity or decision to be undertaken hereunder, reasonable, good faith efforts to accomplish such objective,
activity or decision as such Party would normally use to accomplish a similar objective, activity or decision under similar circumstances; and (b) with
respect to Development and Commercialization of any Licensed Product for any indication by a Party, efforts and resources consistent with those efforts
and resources commonly used by a similarly situated biotechnology company with respect to a product owned by it or to which it has similar rights,
which product is at a similar stage in its development or product life and is of similar market potential taking into account (i) the patent and other
proprietary position of the Licensed Product and (ii) the anticipated profitability of the Licensed Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.26 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts” means: (a) with respect to the efforts to be expended, or considerations to be undertaken, by a Party or its
Affiliate with respect to any objective, activity or decision to be undertaken hereunder, reasonable efforts to accomplish such objective, activity or decision; and (b) with
respect to Development and Commercialization of any Licensed Product for any indication by a Party, efforts and resources consistent with those efforts
and resources commonly used by a biotechnology company with respect to a product owned by it or to which it has similar rights, which product is at a similar stage in its product life.
perturbation.explanation: By removing key phrases in sections (a) and (b), this definition becomes ambiguous. Removing 'good faith efforts' from (a) introduces uncertainty about the required effort level. In section (b), removing consideration of the 'patent position' and 'anticipated profitability' undermines the concept of Commercialy Reasonable Efforts if profitability is not taken into account.

perturbation.original_text:
5.5 Decisions that are not Reserved. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Article 5 or any other section of this Agreement: (a) the Minimum
Requirements may not be modified, amended or otherwise changed without the written consent of CytoDyn, such consent not to be unreasonably
withheld, conditioned or delayed; and [***].
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5 Decisions that are not Reserved. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Article 5 or any other section of this Agreement: (a) the Requirements may not be modified, amended or otherwise changed without the written consent of CytoDyn, such consent may be withheld or delayed; and [***].
perturbation.explanation: By removing “Minimum” and removing  'such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed', allows CytoDyn to refuse consent without providing any justification. This creates conflict with clauses that impose commercially reasonable efforts and good faith, which usually require justification for refusal, creating an enforcement contradiction.
